briefdescription.para: Archives the object into the archive message.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the BMessage object to archive the object into.
Whether or not to archive child views as well.

simplesect.para: A status code, B_OK if everything went well or an error code otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Creates a new BScrollView object from the archive message.

simplesect.para: A newly created scroll view or NULL if the message doesn't contain an archived BScrollView object.

detaileddescription.para: Similar to AttachedToWindow() but this method is triggered after all child views have already been attached to a window.
Similar to AttachedToWindow() but this method is triggered after all child views have already been detached from a window.

briefdescription.para: Hook method called when the scroll bar is attached to a window.

detaileddescription.para: Checks if the window uses B_DOCUMENT_LOOK and adjust the size of the bars to make room for the window resize knob.

briefdescription.para: Hook method called when the object is detached from a window.
Draws the area of the scroll view that intersects updateRect.

parameterdescription.para: The rectangular area to be drawn.

briefdescription.para: Hook method called when the scroll view is moved.

parameterdescription.para: The point of the top left corner of the frame that the view has been moved to.

briefdescription.para: Hook method called when the scroll view is resized.

detaileddescription.para: If the scroll view is part of a layout, the default implementation will re-proportion the attached scrollbars relative to the new size.
Handle message received by the associated looper.

parameterdescription.para: The message received by the associated looper.

detaileddescription.para: Hook method called when a mouse button is pressed.

parameterdescription.para: The point on the screen where to mouse pointer is when the mouse button is pressed.

detaileddescription.para: Hook method called when the mouse is moved.

parameterdescription.para: The new location of the mouse in the view's coordinate system.

One of the following:
B_ENTERED_VIEW The cursor has just entered the view.
B_INSIDE_VIEW The cursor is inside the view.
B_EXITED_VIEW The cursor has left the view's bounds. This only gets sent if the scope of the mouse events that the view can receive has been expanded by SetEventMask() or SetMouseEventMask().
B_OUTSIDE_VIEW The cursor is outside the view. This only gets sent if the scope of the mouse events that the view can receive has been expanded by SetEventMask() or SetMouseEventMask().
If a drag-and-drop operation is taking place this is a pointer to a BMessage that holds the drag information, otherwise the pointer is NULL.

detaileddescription.para: Hook method called when a mouse button is released.

parameterdescription.para: The point on the screen where to mouse pointer is when the mouse button is released.

detaileddescription.para: Hook method called when the attached window is activated or deactivated.

parameterdescription.para: true when the window becomes activated, false when the window becomes deactivated.

briefdescription.para: Makes the scroll view the current focus view of the window or gives up being the window's focus view.

detaileddescription.para: The focus view handles selections and KeyDown events when the the attached window is active. There can be only one focus view at a time per window.
When called with focus set to true this method first calls MakeFocus() on the previously focused view with focus set to false.

The focus doesn't automatically change when MouseDown() is called so calling MakeFocus() is the only way to make a view the focus view of a window. Classes derived from BView that can display the current selection, or that can accept pasted data should call MakeFocus() in their MouseDown() method to update the focus view of the window on click.
If the view isn't attached to a window this method has no effect.

parameterdescription.para: true to set focus, false to remove it.

briefdescription.para: Returns the BScrollBar object at the given direction.

parameterdescription.para:
The direction of the desired scroll bar, one of the following:
B_HORIZONTAL to get the horizontal scroll bar
B_VERTICAL to get the vertical scroll bar

simplesect.para: A pointer to the desired BScrollBar object or NULL if there was no scroll bar at that location.

briefdescription.para: Set the border style of the scroll view.

parameterdescription.para:
The border style constant to use, one of the following:
B_PLAIN_BORDER
B_FANCY_BORDER
B_NO_BORDER

briefdescription.para: Return the border style used.
Highlights or unhighlights the border of the scroll view's scroll bars.

parameterdescription.para: true to turn highlighting on, false to remove it.

simplesect.para: If successful returns B_OK, otherwise, returns B_ERROR.

briefdescription.para: Returns whether or not the border is highlighted.

simplesect.para: true if the border is highlighted, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Sets the target view that the scroll bars operates on unsetting the previous target.

parameterdescription.para: The target view to set.

briefdescription.para: Returns a pointer to the target view.

simplesect.para: A pointer to a BView object that represents the target view or NULL if the target is not set.

memberdef.argsstring: (BMessage *message, int32 index, BMessage *specifier, int32 what, const char *property)
memberdef.name: ResolveSpecifier

briefdescription.para: Determine the proper handler for a scripting message.

detaileddescription.para: Determine the proper handler for a scripting message.

parameterdescription.para: The scripting message to determine the handler.
The index of the specifier.
The message which contains the specifier.
The 'what' field of the specifier message.
The name of the target property.

simplesect.para: A pointer to the proper BHandler for the given scripting message.

briefdescription.para: Reports the suites of messages and specifiers understood by the scroll view.

detaileddescription.para: Reports the suites of messages and specifiers that derived classes understand.

briefdescription.para: Archive constructor.

parameterdescription.para: The message data to construct the scroll view from.

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *name, BView *target, uint32 flags, bool horizontal, bool vertical, border_style border=B_FANCY_BORDER)
memberdef.name: BScrollView

briefdescription.para: Instantiates a new scroll view and connects it to the target view suitable for use in a BLayout.

parameterdescription.para: The name of the scroll bar, can be NULL.
The target view to scroll, can be NULL.
The view flags. See BView for details.
Whether or not to include a horizontal scroll bar.
Whether or not to include a vertical scroll bar.

The border style to use, options include:
B_PLAIN_BORDER
B_FANCY_BORDER
B_NO_BORDER

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *name, BView *target, uint32 resizingMode=B_FOLLOW_LEFT_TOP, uint32 flags=0, bool horizontal=false, bool vertical=false, border_style border=B_FANCY_BORDER)
memberdef.name: BScrollView

briefdescription.para: Instantiates a new scroll view and connects it to the target view.

parameterdescription.para: The name of the scroll bar, can be NULL.
The target view to scroll, can be NULL.
Defines the scroll view's behavior when its parent is resized. See BView for details.
The view flags. See BView for details.
Whether or not to include a horizontal scroll bar.
Whether or not to include a vertical scroll bar.

The border style to use, options include:
B_PLAIN_BORDER
B_FANCY_BORDER
B_NO_BORDER

briefdescription.para: Destructor method.

detaileddescription.para: Deletes the scroll view, sets the target to NULL and frees any memory used.

briefdescription.para: Hook method called when all views have been unarchived.
Fill out the preferred width and height of the scroll view into the _width and _height parameters.

detaileddescription.para: Derived classes should override this method to set the preferred size of object.

simplesect.para: Either the _width or _height parameter may be set to NULL if you only want to get the other one.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to a float to store the width of the view.
Pointer to a float to store the height of the view.

briefdescription.para: Return the scroll view's maximum size.

simplesect.para: The maximum size of the scroll view as a BSize.

briefdescription.para: Return the scroll view's minimum size.

simplesect.para: The minimum size of the scroll view as a BSize.

briefdescription.para: Perform some action. (Internal Method)
Return the scroll view's preferred size.

simplesect.para: The preferred size of the scroll view as a BSize.

briefdescription.para: Resizes the scroll view to its preferred size keeping the position of the left top corner constant.

simplesect.para: It is not recommended to use this method for views that are part of a BLayout.

briefdescription.para: Layout view within the layout context.
Hook method called when the layout is invalidated.

detaileddescription.para: The default implementation does nothing.

parameterdescription.para: Whether or not child views have also been invalidated.

memberdef.argsstring: (BRect frame, BScrollBar *horizontal, BScrollBar *vertical, border_style border, uint32 borders)
memberdef.name: _ComputeFrame

memberdef.argsstring: (BView *target, BScrollBar *horizontal, BScrollBar *vertical, border_style border, uint32 borders)

memberdef.argsstring: (BRect &frame, border_style border, uint32 borders, bool expand=false)
memberdef.name: _InsetBorders

briefdescription.para: A convenience class used to add scrolling to a target view.

detaileddescription.para: The BScrollView is a convenience class to add a scrolling mechanism to the target view.
The BScrollView class conveniently provides a container view adding the scroll bars and target view as siblings so that when one is moved or resized the rest can follow.

simplesect.para: BScrollBar to learn more about how scroll bars work.
